_header: Thou First Mover that causest all thing
_description: John Lydgate, an Invocation to St. Anne — eleven stanzas rhyme royal

BodAsh59.First Lines:
THowe first moever þat causest euery thingeTo haue his keping
                    thorughe þy provydenceAnd rightfully art called lorde and
                    kyngHavinge þe lordship of eche intelligence…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…He graunte vs mercy in þis exyle hereSith he vs bought
                    with his blode so dere
BodAsh59.Attributed Title:
Here begynneþe a devoute Invocacoun to sainte Anne by þat
                    solempne Religious Lidegate made at þe commaundement of my ladye Anne
                    Countasse of Stafford (f. 44v)

BLAdd16165.First Lines:
Þou first moeuer þat causest euery thingTo haue his
                    keping thoroughe prouyndence…
BLAdd16165.Last Lines:
…He graunt vs mercy in his exyle heereSich he vs bought with
                    his blood so deer
BLAdd16165.Attributed Title: Invocation by Lidegate to Saynte Anne (f. 247)
BLAdd16165.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
